title: What will be my SGPA if my final score in each subject is 65/100?

comments.body:
Here's how to calculate your sgpa
First you need to know what grade point is for each grade
S-10, A-9, B-8, C-7, D-6, E-5
Sum = (Grade point x Number of Credits of that subject)
Calculate this for all your subjects and add them up.
For example, if you've scores 3 B grades in your 4 credit courses and 2 A grades in your 5 credit courses your sum will look like this
(8x4)+(8x4)+(8x4)+(9x9)+(9x9)

Now divide the above sum by the total number of credits in that particular semester.

SGPA = Sum(Grade points x Credits of that subject)/Total credits in that sem
Bruh what nonsense calculation makes absolutely no sense,please don't go around spreading misinformation here
Hmm so pretty much C grade in each subject then...so yeah that comes to around 7-7.5 range

This doesn't take into account relative grading. Sometimes when there's relative grading, your grade sometimes changes. Last sem I needed 104/100 in the ESA for an S and I still got the S even though I got 83 in the ESA. Sometimes your grade goes up because of relative grading
